CreateJS.name: CreateJS
CreateJS.description:
A collection of Classes that are shared across all the CreateJS libraries. The classes are included in the minified files of each library and are available on the createsjs namespace directly.

Example

myObject.addEventListener("change", createjs.proxy(myMethod, scope));

TweenJS.name: TweenJS

Event.name: Event
Event.description:
Contains properties and methods shared by all events for use with
{{#crossLink "EventDispatcher"}}{{/crossLink}}.

Note that Event objects are often reused, so you should never
rely on an event object's state outside of the call stack it was received in.

params.name: type
params.description: The event type.

params.name: bubbles
params.description: Indicates whether the event will bubble through the display list.

params.name: cancelable
params.description: Indicates whether the default behaviour of this event can be cancelled.

EventDispatcher.name: EventDispatcher

CSSPlugin.name: CSSPlugin
CSSPlugin.description: A TweenJS plugin for working with numeric CSS string properties (ex. top, left). To use simply install after TweenJS has loaded: createjs.CSSPlugin.install(); You can adjust the CSS properties it will work with by modifying the cssSuffixMap property. Currently, the top, left, bottom, right, width, height have a "px" suffix appended. Please note that the CSS Plugin is not included in the TweenJS minified file.

Ease.name: Ease
Ease.description: The Ease class provides a collection of easing functions for use with TweenJS. It does not use the standard 4 param easing signature. Instead it uses a single param which indicates the current linear ratio (0 to 1) of the tween. Most methods on Ease can be passed directly as easing functions: Tween.get(target).to({x:100}, 500, Ease.linear); However, methods beginning with "get" will return an easing function based on parameter values: Tween.get(target).to({y:200}, 500, Ease.getPowIn(2.2)); Please see the spark table demo for an overview of the different ease types on TweenJS.com. Equations derived from work by Robert Penner.

MotionGuidePlugin.name: MotionGuidePlugin
MotionGuidePlugin.description:
A TweenJS plugin for working with motion guides. To use, install the plugin after TweenJS has loaded. Next tween the 'guide' property with an object as detailed below. createjs.MotionGuidePlugin.install();

Example

// Using a Motion Guide createjs.Tween.get(target).to({guide:{ path:[0,0, 0,200,200,200, 200,0,0,0] }},7000); // Visualizing the line graphics.moveTo(0,0).curveTo(0,200,200,200).curveTo(200,0,0,0); Each path needs pre-computation to ensure there's fast performance. Because of the pre-computation there's no built in support for path changes mid tween. These are the Guide Object's properties:
  • path: Required, Array : The x/y points used to draw the path with a moveTo and 1 to n curveTo calls.
  • start: Optional, 0-1 : Initial position, default 0 except for when continuing along the same path.
  • end: Optional, 0-1 : Final position, default 1 if not specified.
  • orient: Optional, string : "fixed"/"auto"/"cw"/"ccw"
    • "fixed" forces the object to face down the path all movement (relative to start rotation),
    • "auto" rotates the object along the path relative to the line.
    • "cw"/"ccw" force clockwise or counter clockwise rotations including flash like behaviour
Guide objects should not be shared between tweens even if all properties are identical, the library stores information on these objects in the background and sharing them can cause unexpected behaviour. Values outside 0-1 range of tweens will be a "best guess" from the appropriate part of the defined curve.

SamplePlugin.name: SamplePlugin
SamplePlugin.description: A sample TweenJS plugin. This plugin does not actually affect tweens in any way, it's merely intended to document how to build TweenJS plugins. Please look at the code for inline comments. A TweenJS plugin is simply an object that exposes one property (priority), and three methods (init, step, and tween). Generally a plugin will also expose an install method as well, though this is not strictly necessary.

Timeline.name: Timeline
Timeline.description:
The Timeline class synchronizes multiple tweens and allows them to be controlled as a group. Please note that if a
timeline is looping, the tweens on it may appear to loop even if the "loop" property of the tween is false.

params.name: tweens
params.description: An array of Tweens to add to this timeline. See addTween for more info.

params.name: labels
props
params.description:
The configuration properties to apply to this tween instance (ex. `{loop:true}`). All properties default to false. Supported props are:
  • loop: sets the loop property on this tween.
  • useTicks: uses ticks for all durations instead of milliseconds.
  • ignoreGlobalPause: sets the ignoreGlobalPause property on this tween.
  • paused: indicates whether to start the tween paused.
  • position: indicates the initial position for this timeline.
  • onChange: specifies a listener to add for the {{#crossLink "Timeline/change:event"}}{{/crossLink}} event.

Tween.name: Tween

params.name: target
params.description: The target object that will have its properties tweened.

params.name: props
params.description:
The configuration properties to apply to this tween instance (ex. `{loop:true, paused:true}`. All properties default to false. Supported props are:
  • loop: sets the loop property on this tween.
  • useTicks: uses ticks for all durations instead of milliseconds.
  • ignoreGlobalPause: sets the ignoreGlobalPause property on this tween.
  • override: if true, `Tween.removeTweens(target)` will be called to remove any other tweens with the same target.
  • paused: indicates whether to start the tween paused.
  • position: indicates the initial position for this tween.
  • onChange: specifies a listener for the "change" event.

params.name: pluginData
params.description:
An object containing data for use by installed plugins. See individual
plugins' documentation for details.

TweenJS.name: TweenJS
TweenJS.description:
Static class holding library specific information such as the version and buildDate of
the library.

classitems.description: The type of event.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description: The object that generated an event.
classitems.name: target

classitems.description:
The current target that a bubbling event is being dispatched from. For non-bubbling events, this will
always be the same as target. For example, if childObj.parent = parentObj, and a bubbling event
is generated from childObj, then a listener on parentObj would receive the event with
target=childObj (the original target) and currentTarget=parentObj (where the listener was added).
classitems.name: currentTarget

classitems.description:
For bubbling events, this indicates the current event phase:
  1. capture phase: starting from the top parent to the target
  2. at target phase: currently being dispatched from the target
  3. bubbling phase: from the target to the top parent
classitems.name: eventPhase

classitems.description: Indicates whether the event will bubble through the display list.
classitems.name: bubbles

classitems.description:
Indicates whether the default behaviour of this event can be cancelled via
{{#crossLink "Event/preventDefault"}}{{/crossLink}}. This is set via the Event constructor.
classitems.name: cancelable

classitems.description: The epoch time at which this event was created.
classitems.name: timeStamp

classitems.description:
Indicates if {{#crossLink "Event/preventDefault"}}{{/crossLink}} has been called
on this event.
classitems.name: defaultPrevented

classitems.description:
Indicates if {{#crossLink "Event/stopPropagation"}}{{/crossLink}} or
{{#crossLink "Event/stopImmediatePropagation"}}{{/crossLink}} has been called on this event.
classitems.name: propagationStopped

classitems.description:
Indicates if {{#crossLink "Event/stopImmediatePropagation"}}{{/crossLink}} has been called
on this event.
classitems.name: immediatePropagationStopped

classitems.description: Indicates if {{#crossLink "Event/remove"}}{{/crossLink}} has been called on this event.
classitems.name: removed

classitems.description: Initialization method.
classitems.name: initialize

params.name: type
params.description: The event type.

params.name: bubbles
params.description: Indicates whether the event will bubble through the display list.

params.name: cancelable
params.description: Indicates whether the default behaviour of this event can be cancelled.

classitems.description:
Sets {{#crossLink "Event/defaultPrevented"}}{{/crossLink}} to true.
Mirrors the DOM event standard.
classitems.name: preventDefault

classitems.description:
Sets {{#crossLink "Event/propagationStopped"}}{{/crossLink}} to true.
Mirrors the DOM event standard.
classitems.name: stopPropagation

classitems.description:
Sets {{#crossLink "Event/propagationStopped"}}{{/crossLink}} and
{{#crossLink "Event/immediatePropagationStopped"}}{{/crossLink}} to true.
Mirrors the DOM event standard.
classitems.name: stopImmediatePropagation
remove

classitems.description: Returns a clone of the Event instance.
classitems.name: clone

return.description: a clone of the Event instance.

classitems.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
classitems.name: toString

return.description: a string representation of the instance.

classitems.description:
Static initializer to mix EventDispatcher methods into a target object or prototype.

		EventDispatcher.initialize(MyClass.prototype); // add to the prototype of the class
		EventDispatcher.initialize(myObject); // add to a specific instance
classitems.name: initialize

params.name: target
params.description:
The target object to inject EventDispatcher methods into. This can be an instance or a
prototype.

classitems.description: Initialization method.
classitems.name: initialize
addEventListener

params.name: type
params.description: The string type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description:
An object with a handleEvent method, or a function that will be called when
the event is dispatched.

params.name: useCapture
params.description: For events that bubble, indicates whether to listen for the event in the capture or bubbling/target phase.

return.description: Returns the listener for chaining or assignment.

classitems.name: on

params.name: type
params.description: The string type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description:
An object with a handleEvent method, or a function that will be called when
the event is dispatched.

params.name: scope
params.description: The scope to execute the listener in. Defaults to the dispatcher/currentTarget for function listeners, and to the listener itself for object listeners (ie. using handleEvent).

params.name: once
params.description: If true, the listener will remove itself after the first time it is triggered.

params.name: data
params.description: Arbitrary data that will be included as the second parameter when the listener is called.

params.name: useCapture
params.description: For events that bubble, indicates whether to listen for the event in the capture or bubbling/target phase.

return.description: Returns the anonymous function that was created and assigned as the listener. This is needed to remove the listener later using .removeEventListener.

classitems.description:
Removes the specified event listener. Important Note: that you must pass the exact function reference used when the event was added. If a proxy function, or function closure is used as the callback, the proxy/closure reference must be used - a new proxy or closure will not work.

Example

displayObject.removeEventListener("click", handleClick);
classitems.name: removeEventListener

params.name: type
params.description: The string type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description: The listener function or object.

params.name: useCapture
params.description: For events that bubble, indicates whether to listen for the event in the capture or bubbling/target phase.

classitems.description:
A shortcut to the removeEventListener method, with the same parameters and return value. This is a companion to the
.on method.
classitems.name: off

params.name: type
params.description: The string type of the event.

params.name: listener
params.description: The listener function or object.

params.name: useCapture
params.description: For events that bubble, indicates whether to listen for the event in the capture or bubbling/target phase.

classitems.name: removeAllEventListeners

params.name: type
params.description: The string type of the event. If omitted, all listeners for all types will be removed.

classitems.name: dispatchEvent

params.name: eventObj
params.description:
An object with a "type" property, or a string type.
While a generic object will work, it is recommended to use a CreateJS Event instance. If a string is used,
dispatchEvent will construct an Event instance with the specified type.

params.name: target
params.description: The object to use as the target property of the event object. This will default to the dispatching object. This parameter is deprecated and will be removed.

return.description: Returns the value of eventObj.defaultPrevented.

classitems.description: Indicates whether there is at least one listener for the specified event type and `useCapture` value.
classitems.name: hasEventListener

params.name: type
params.description: The string type of the event.

return.description: Returns true if there is at least one listener for the specified event.
a string representation of the instance.

classitems.description:
Defines the default suffix map for CSS tweens. This can be overridden on a per tween basis by specifying a
cssSuffixMap value for the individual tween. The object maps CSS property names to the suffix to use when
reading or setting those properties. For example a map in the form {top:"px"} specifies that when tweening
the "top" CSS property, it should use the "px" suffix (ex. target.style.top = "20.5px"). This only applies
to tweens with the "css" config property set to true.
classitems.name: cssSuffixMap

classitems.description: Installs this plugin for use with TweenJS. Call this once after TweenJS is loaded to enable this plugin.
classitems.name: install

classitems.description: Identical to linear.
classitems.name: none

classitems.description: Mimics the simple -100 to 100 easing in Flash Pro.
classitems.name: get

params.name: amount
params.description: A value from -1 (ease in) to 1 (ease out) indicating the strength and direction of the ease.

classitems.description: Configurable exponential ease.
classitems.name: getPowIn

params.name: pow
params.description: The exponent to use (ex. 3 would return a cubic ease).

classitems.description: Configurable exponential ease.
classitems.name: getPowOut

params.name: pow
params.description: The exponent to use (ex. 3 would return a cubic ease).

classitems.description: Configurable exponential ease.
classitems.name: getPowInOut

params.name: pow
params.description: The exponent to use (ex. 3 would return a cubic ease).

classitems.description: Configurable "back in" ease.
classitems.name: getBackIn

params.name: amount
params.description: The strength of the ease.

classitems.description: Configurable "back out" ease.
classitems.name: getBackOut

params.name: amount
params.description: The strength of the ease.

classitems.description: Configurable "back in out" ease.
classitems.name: getBackInOut

params.name: amount
params.description: The strength of the ease.

classitems.description: Configurable elastic ease.
classitems.name: getElasticIn

classitems.description: Configurable elastic ease.
classitems.name: getElasticOut

classitems.description: Configurable elastic ease.
classitems.name: getElasticInOut

classitems.description: Installs this plugin for use with TweenJS. Call this once after TweenJS is loaded to enable this plugin.
classitems.name: install

classitems.description:
Determine the appropriate x/y/rotation information about a path for a given ratio along the path.
Assumes a path object with all optional parameters specified.

params.name: data
params.description: Data object you would pass to the "guide:" property in a Tween

params.name: ratio
params.description: 0-1 Distance along path, values outside 0-1 are "best guess"

params.name: target
params.description: Object to copy the results onto, will use a new object if not supplied.

return.description: The target object or a new object w/ the tweened properties

classitems.description:
Used by TweenJS to determine when to call this plugin. Plugins with higher priority have their methods called
before plugins with lower priority. The priority value can be any positive or negative number.
classitems.name: priority

classitems.description:
Installs this plugin for use with TweenJS, and registers for a list of properties that this plugin will operate
with. Call this once after TweenJS is loaded to enable this plugin.
classitems.name: install

classitems.description: Called by TweenJS when a new tween property initializes that this plugin is registered for. Generally, the call to Plugin.init will be immediately followed by a call to Plugin.to.
classitems.name: init

params.name: tween
params.description: The related tween instance.

params.name: prop
params.description: The name of the property that is being initialized.

params.name: value
params.description: The current value of the property on the tween's target.

return.description:
The starting tween value for the property. In most cases, you would simply
return the value parameter, but some plugins may need to modify the starting value.

classitems.description:
Called by TweenJS when a new step is added to a tween that includes a property the plugin is registered for (ie.
a new "to" action is added to a tween).
classitems.name: init

params.name: tween
params.description: The related tween instance.

params.name: prop
params.description: The name of the property being tweened.

params.name: startValue
params.description:
The value of the property at the beginning of the step. This will
be the same as the init value if this is the first step, or the same as the
endValue of the previous step if not.

params.name: injectProps
params.description: A generic object to which the plugin can append other properties which should be updated on this step.

params.name: endValue
params.description: The value of the property at the end of the step.

classitems.description: Called when a tween property advances that this plugin is registered for.
classitems.name: tween

params.name: tween
params.description: The related tween instance.

params.name: prop
params.description: The name of the property being tweened.

params.name: value
params.description: The current tweened value of the property, as calculated by TweenJS.

params.name: startValues
params.description:
A hash of all of the property values at the start of the current
step. You could access the start value of the current property using
startValues[prop].

params.name: endValues
params.description:
A hash of all of the property values at the end of the current
step.

params.name: ratio
params.description:
A value indicating the eased progress through the current step. This
number is generally between 0 and 1, though some eases will generate values outside
this range.

params.name: wait
params.description: Indicates whether the current step is a "wait" step.

params.name: end
params.description: Indicates that the tween has reached the end.

return.description: Return the value that should be assigned to the target property. For example returning Math.round(value) would assign the default calculated value as an integer. Returning Tween.IGNORE will prevent Tween from assigning a value to the target property.

classitems.description: Causes this timeline to continue playing when a global pause is active.
classitems.name: ignoreGlobalPause

classitems.description:
Read-only property specifying the total duration of this timeline in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true).
This value is usually automatically updated as you modify the timeline. See updateDuration for more information.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description: If true, the timeline will loop when it reaches the end. Can be set via the props param.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description:
REMOVED. Use {{#crossLink "EventDispatcher/addEventListener"}}{{/crossLink}} and the {{#crossLink "Timeline/change:event"}}{{/crossLink}}
event.
classitems.name: onChange

classitems.description:
Read-only. The current normalized position of the timeline. This will always be a value between 0 and duration.
Changing this property directly will have no effect.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description: Called whenever the timeline's position changes.
classitems.name: change

classitems.description: Initialization method.
classitems.name: initialize

classitems.description:
Adds one or more tweens (or timelines) to this timeline. The tweens will be paused (to remove them from the normal ticking system)
and managed by this timeline. Adding a tween to multiple timelines will result in unexpected behaviour.
classitems.name: addTween

params.name: tween
params.description: The tween(s) to add. Accepts multiple arguments.

return.description: Tween The first tween that was passed in.

classitems.description: Removes one or more tweens from this timeline.
classitems.name: removeTween

params.name: tween
params.description: The tween(s) to remove. Accepts multiple arguments.

return.description: Boolean Returns true if all of the tweens were successfully removed.

classitems.description: Adds a label that can be used with {{#crossLink "Timeline/gotoAndPlay"}}{{/crossLink}}/{{#crossLink "Timeline/gotoAndStop"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: addLabel

params.name: label
params.description: The label name.

params.name: position
params.description: The position this label represents.

classitems.description: Defines labels for use with gotoAndPlay/Stop. Overwrites any previously set labels.
classitems.name: setLabels

params.name: o
params.description:
An object defining labels for using gotoAndPlay/Stop in the form `{labelName:time}` where time is in
milliseconds (or ticks if `useTicks` is true).

classitems.description: Returns a sorted list of the labels defined on this timeline.
classitems.name: getLabels

return.description: A sorted array of objects with label and position properties.

classitems.description:
Returns the name of the label on or immediately before the current position. For example, given a timeline with two labels, "first" on frame index 4, and "second" on frame 8, getCurrentLabel would return:
  • null if the current position is 2.
  • "first" if the current position is 4.
  • "first" if the current position is 7.
  • "second" if the current position is 15.
classitems.name: getCurrentLabel

return.description: The name of the current label or null if there is no label

classitems.description: Unpauses this timeline and jumps to the specified position or label.
classitems.name: gotoAndPlay

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The position in milliseconds (or ticks if `useTicks` is true) or label to jump to.

classitems.description: Pauses this timeline and jumps to the specified position or label.
classitems.name: gotoAndStop

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: The position in milliseconds (or ticks if `useTicks` is true) or label to jump to.

classitems.description: Advances the timeline to the specified position.
classitems.name: setPosition

params.name: value
params.description: The position to seek to in milliseconds (or ticks if `useTicks` is true).

params.name: actionsMode
params.description:
parameter specifying how actions are handled. See the Tween {{#crossLink "Tween/setPosition"}}{{/crossLink}}
method for more details.

return.description: Returns true if the timeline is complete (ie. the full timeline has run & loop is false).

classitems.description: Pauses or plays this timeline.
classitems.name: setPaused

params.name: value
params.description: Indicates whether the tween should be paused (true) or played (false).

classitems.description:
Recalculates the duration of the timeline.
The duration is automatically updated when tweens are added or removed, but this method is useful
if you modify a tween after it was added to the timeline.
classitems.name: updateDuration

classitems.description:
Advances this timeline by the specified amount of time in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true).
This is normally called automatically by the Tween engine (via Tween.tick), but is exposed for advanced uses.
classitems.name: tick

params.name: delta
params.description: The time to advance in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true).

classitems.description:
If a numeric position is passed, it is returned unchanged. If a string is passed, the position of the
corresponding frame label will be returned, or null if a matching label is not defined.
classitems.name: resolve

params.name: positionOrLabel
params.description: A numeric position value or label string.

classitems.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
classitems.name: toString

return.description: a string representation of the instance.

classitems.description: Constant defining the none actionsMode for use with setPosition.
classitems.name: NONE

classitems.description: Constant defining the loop actionsMode for use with setPosition.
classitems.name: LOOP

classitems.description: Constant defining the reverse actionsMode for use with setPosition.
classitems.name: REVERSE

classitems.description: Constant returned by plugins to tell the tween not to use default assignment.
classitems.name: IGNORE

classitems.description:
Returns a new tween instance. This is functionally identical to using "new Tween(...)", but looks cleaner
with the chained syntax of TweenJS.
classitems.name: get

params.name: target
params.description: The target object that will have its properties tweened.

params.name: props
params.description:
The configuration properties to apply to this tween instance (ex. {loop:true, paused:true}). All properties default to false. Supported props are:
  • loop: sets the loop property on this tween.
  • useTicks: uses ticks for all durations instead of milliseconds.
  • ignoreGlobalPause: sets the ignoreGlobalPause property on this tween.
  • override: if true, Tween.removeTweens(target) will be called to remove any other tweens with the same target.
  • paused: indicates whether to start the tween paused.
  • position: indicates the initial position for this tween.
  • onChange: specifies a listener for the "change" event.

params.name: pluginData
params.description:
An object containing data for use by installed plugins. See individual
plugins' documentation for details.

params.name: override
params.description: If true, any previous tweens on the same target will be removed. This is the same as calling Tween.removeTweens(target).

return.description:
A reference to the created tween. Additional chained tweens, method calls, or callbacks can be
applied to the returned tween instance.

classitems.description: Advances all tweens. This typically uses the Ticker class (available in the EaselJS library), but you can call it manually if you prefer to use your own "heartbeat" implementation. Note: Currently, EaselJS must be included before TweenJS to ensure Ticker exists during initialization.
classitems.name: tick

params.name: delta
params.description: The change in time in milliseconds since the last tick. Required unless all tweens have useTicks set to true.

params.name: paused
params.description: Indicates whether a global pause is in effect. Tweens with ignoreGlobalPause will ignore this, but all others will pause if this is true.

classitems.description: Handle events that result from Tween being used as an event handler. This is included to allow Tween to handle tick events from createjs.Ticker. No other events are handled in Tween.
classitems.name: handleEvent

params.name: event
params.description: An event object passed in by the EventDispatcher. Will usually be of type "tick".

classitems.description: Removes all existing tweens for a target. This is called automatically by new tweens if the override property is true.
classitems.name: removeTweens

params.name: target
params.description: The target object to remove existing tweens from.

classitems.description: Stop and remove all existing tweens.
classitems.name: removeAllTweens

classitems.description: Indicates whether there are any active tweens (and how many) on the target object (if specified) or in general.
classitems.name: hasActiveTweens

params.name: target
params.description:
The target to check for active tweens. If not specified, the return value will indicate
if there are any active tweens on any target.

return.description: If there are active tweens.

classitems.description:
Installs a plugin, which can modify how certain properties are handled when tweened. See the CSSPlugin for an
example of how to write TweenJS plugins.
classitems.name: installPlugin

params.name: plugin
params.description: The plugin class to install

params.name: properties
params.description: An array of properties that the plugin will handle.

classitems.description: Registers or unregisters a tween with the ticking system.
classitems.name: _register

params.name: tween
params.description: The tween instance to register or unregister.

params.name: value
params.description: If true, the tween is registered. If false the tween is unregistered.

classitems.description: Causes this tween to continue playing when a global pause is active. For example, if TweenJS is using Ticker, then setting this to true (the default) will cause this tween to be paused when Ticker.setPaused(true) is called. See Tween.tick() for more info. Can be set via the props param.
classitems.name: ignoreGlobalPause

classitems.description: If true, the tween will loop when it reaches the end. Can be set via the props param.
classitems.name: loop

classitems.description:
Read-only. Specifies the total duration of this tween in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true).
This value is automatically updated as you modify the tween. Changing it directly could result in unexpected
behaviour.
classitems.name: duration

classitems.description:
Allows you to specify data that will be used by installed plugins. Each plugin uses this differently, but in general
you specify data by setting it to a property of pluginData with the same name as the plugin class.
example:
myTween.pluginData.PluginClassName_enabled = false;

Some plugins also store instance data in this object, usually in a property named _PluginClassName. See the documentation for individual plugins for more details.
classitems.name: pluginData

classitems.description:
REMOVED. Use {{#crossLink "EventDispatcher/addEventListener"}}{{/crossLink}} and the {{#crossLink "Tween/change:event"}}{{/crossLink}}
event.
classitems.name: onChange

classitems.description:
Read-only. The target of this tween. This is the object on which the tweened properties will be changed. Changing
this property after the tween is created will not have any effect.
classitems.name: target

classitems.description:
Read-only. The current normalized position of the tween. This will always be a value between 0 and duration.
Changing this property directly will have no effect.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description: Read-only. Indicates the tween's current position is within a passive wait.
classitems.name: passive

classitems.description: Called whenever the tween's position changes.
classitems.name: change

classitems.description: Raw position.
classitems.name: _prevPosition

classitems.description: The position within the current step.
classitems.name: _stepPosition

classitems.description: Normalized position.
classitems.name: _prevPos

classitems.description: Queues a wait (essentially an empty tween).
example:
//This tween will wait 1s before alpha is faded to 0.
	createjs.Tween.get(target).wait(1000).to({alpha:0}, 1000);
classitems.name: wait

params.name: duration
params.description: The duration of the wait in milliseconds (or in ticks if useTicks is true).

params.name: passive
params.description:
Tween properties will not be updated during a passive wait. This
is mostly useful for use with Timeline's that contain multiple tweens affecting the same target
at different times.

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls).

classitems.description:
Queues a tween from the current values to the target properties. Set duration to 0 to jump to these value.
Numeric properties will be tweened from their current value in the tween to the target value. Non-numeric
properties will be set at the end of the specified duration.
classitems.name: to

params.name: props
params.description: An object specifying property target values for this tween (Ex. {x:300} would tween the x property of the target to 300).

params.name: duration
params.description: Optional. The duration of the wait in milliseconds (or in ticks if useTicks is true). Defaults to 0.

params.name: ease
params.description: Optional. The easing function to use for this tween. Defaults to a linear ease.

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls).

classitems.description: Queues an action to call the specified function.
classitems.name: call

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to call.

params.name: params
params.description:
Optional. The parameters to call the function with. If this is omitted, then the function
     will be called with a single param pointing to this tween.

params.name: scope
params.description:
Optional. The scope to call the function in. If omitted, it will be called in the target's
     scope.

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls).

classitems.description:
Queues an action to set the specified props on the specified target. If target is null, it will use this tween's
target.
classitems.name: set

params.name: props
params.description: The properties to set (ex. {visible:false}).

params.name: target
params.description: Optional. The target to set the properties on. If omitted, they will be set on the tween's target.

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls).

classitems.description: Queues an action to to play (unpause) the specified tween. This enables you to sequence multiple tweens.
classitems.name: play

params.name: tween
params.description: The tween to play.

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls).

classitems.description: Queues an action to to pause the specified tween.
classitems.name: pause

params.name: tween
params.description: The tween to play. If null, it pauses this tween.

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls)

classitems.description: Advances the tween to a specified position.
classitems.name: setPosition

params.name: value
params.description: The position to seek to in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true).

params.name: actionsMode
params.description: Optional parameter specifying how actions are handled (ie. call, set, play, pause): Tween.NONE (0) - run no actions. Tween.LOOP (1) - if new position is less than old, then run all actions between old and duration, then all actions between 0 and new. Defaults to LOOP. Tween.REVERSE (2) - if new position is less than old, run all actions between them in reverse.

return.description: Returns true if the tween is complete (ie. the full tween has run & loop is false).

classitems.description: Advances this tween by the specified amount of time in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true). This is normally called automatically by the Tween engine (via Tween.tick), but is exposed for advanced uses.
classitems.name: tick

params.name: delta
params.description: The time to advance in milliseconds (or ticks if useTicks is true).

classitems.description: Pauses or plays this tween.
classitems.name: setPaused

params.name: value
params.description: Indicates whether the tween should be paused (true) or played (false).

return.description: This tween instance (for chaining calls)

classitems.description: Returns a string representation of this object.
classitems.name: toString

return.description: a string representation of the instance.

classitems.description: The version string for this release.
classitems.name: version

classitems.description: The build date for this release in UTC format.
classitems.name: buildDate

warnings.message:
Missing item type
Determine the appropriate x/y/rotation information about a path for a given ratio along the path.
Assumes a path object with all optional parameters specified.
